meanings.definition: To absorb or integrate new information or experiences into existing knowledge or understanding.
meanings.sent1: She was assimilating the new language by practicing every day.
meanings.sent2: The students were assimilating the lesson on photosynthesis.
meanings.sent3: The computer was assimilating so much data, it started speaking in binary code!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a sponge, assimilating all the facts effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The young plant was assimilating sunlight for growth.

meanings.definition: To cause to resemble; make similar or like.
meanings.sent1: The artist was assimilating the colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: The twins often assimilate each other in their mannerisms.
meanings.sent3: The cake was assimilating the flavors of vanilla and chocolate perfectly.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter assimilated with the joyful atmosphere of the party.
meanings.sent5: The chameleon was assimilating with the green leaves to hide from predators.

meanings.definition: To take in and utilize as nourishment; absorb into the system.
meanings.sent1: The body was assimilating the nutrients from the healthy meal.
meanings.sent2: The cells were assimilating the oxygen for respiration.
meanings.sent3: The robot was assimilating energy from solar panels to function efficiently.
meanings.sent4: His mind was assimilating the wisdom shared by the elders.
meanings.sent5: The soil was assimilating the water to support plant growth.
